content:
HttpContextWrapper Class

Definition

Encapsulates the HTTP intrinsic object that contains HTTP-specific information about an individual HTTP request.

In this Article

public class HttpContextWrapper : System.Web.HttpContextBase
Inheritance
Object
System.Web.HttpContextBase
HttpContextWrapper

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The HttpContextWrapper class derives from the HttpContextBase class and serves as a wrapper for the HttpContext class. This class exposes the functionality of the HttpContext class and also exposes the HttpContextBase type. The HttpContextBase class lets you replace the original implementation of the HttpContext class in your application with a custom implementation, such as when you perform unit testing outside the ASP.NET pipeline.

Constructors

HttpContextWrapper(HttpContext)

Initializes a new instance of the HttpContextWrapper class by using the specified context object.

public HttpContextWrapper (System.Web.HttpContext httpContext);
httpContext
HttpContext

The object that this wrapper class provides access to.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

httpContext is null.

Properties

AllErrors

Gets an array of errors (if any) that accumulated when an HTTP request was being processed.

public override Exception[] AllErrors { get; }
Value
Exception[]

An array of Exception objects for the current HTTP request, or null if no errors accumulated during the HTTP request processing.

Application

Gets the HttpApplicationState object for the current HTTP request.

public override System.Web.HttpApplicationStateBase Application { get; }
Value
HttpApplicationStateBase

The state object for the current HTTP request.

ApplicationInstance

Gets or sets the HttpApplication object for the current HTTP request.

public override System.Web.HttpApplication ApplicationInstance { get; set; }
Value
HttpApplication

The object for the current HTTP request.

Cache

Gets the Cache object for the current application domain.

public override System.Web.Caching.Cache Cache { get; }
Value
Cache

The cache object for the current application domain.

CurrentHandler

Gets the IHttpHandler object that represents the handler that is currently executing.

public override System.Web.IHttpHandler CurrentHandler { get; }
Value
IHttpHandler

An object that represents the handler that is currently executing.

CurrentNotification

Gets a RequestNotification value that indicates the current HttpApplication event that is processing.

public override System.Web.RequestNotification CurrentNotification { get; }
Value
RequestNotification

One of the RequestNotification values.

Error

Gets the first error (if any) that accumulated when an HTTP request was being processed.

public override Exception Error { get; }
Value
Exception

The first exception for the current HTTP request, or null if no errors accumulated when the HTTP request was being processed. The default is null.

Handler

Gets or sets the IHttpHandler object that is responsible for processing the HTTP request.

public override System.Web.IHttpHandler Handler { get; set; }
Value
IHttpHandler

The object that is responsible for processing the HTTP request.

IsCustomErrorEnabled

Gets a value that indicates whether custom errors are enabled for the current HTTP request.

public override bool IsCustomErrorEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if custom errors are enabled; otherwise, false.

IsDebuggingEnabled

Gets a value that indicates whether the current HTTP request is in debug mode.

public override bool IsDebuggingEnabled { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the request is in debug mode; otherwise, false.

IsPostNotification

Gets a value that indicates whether an HttpApplication event has finished processing.

public override bool IsPostNotification { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the event has finished processing; otherwise, false.

Items

Gets a key/value collection that can be used to organize and share data between a module and a handler during an HTTP request.

public override System.Collections.IDictionary Items { get; }
Value
IDictionary

A key/value collection that provides access to an individual value in the collection by using a specified key.

PreviousHandler

Gets the IHttpHandler object for the parent handler.

public override System.Web.IHttpHandler PreviousHandler { get; }
Value
IHttpHandler

An IHttpHandler object that represents the parent handler, or null if no parent handler was found.

Profile

Gets the ProfileBase object for the current user profile.

public override System.Web.Profile.ProfileBase Profile { get; }
Value
ProfileBase

If profile properties are defined in the application configuration file and profiles are enabled for the application, an object that represents the current user profile; otherwise, null.

Request

Gets the HttpRequestBase object for the current HTTP request.

public override System.Web.HttpRequestBase Request { get; }
Value
HttpRequestBase

The current HTTP request.

Response

Gets the HttpResponseBase object for the current HTTP response.

public override System.Web.HttpResponseBase Response { get; }
Value
HttpResponseBase

The current HTTP response.

Server

Gets the HttpServerUtilityBase object that provides methods that are used when Web requests are being processed.

public override System.Web.HttpServerUtilityBase Server { get; }
Value
HttpServerUtilityBase

The server utility object for the current HTTP request.

Session

Gets the HttpSessionStateBase object for the current HTTP request.

public override System.Web.HttpSessionStateBase Session { get; }
Value
HttpSessionStateBase

The session-state object for the current HTTP request.

SkipAuthorization

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the UrlAuthorizationModule object should skip the authorization check for the current request.

public override bool SkipAuthorization { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if UrlAuthorizationModule should skip the authorization check; otherwise, false. The default is false.

Timestamp

Gets the initial timestamp of the current HTTP request.

public override DateTime Timestamp { get; }
Value
DateTime

The timestamp of the current HTTP request.

Trace

Gets the TraceContext object for the current HTTP response.

public override System.Web.TraceContext Trace { get; }
Value
TraceContext

The trace object for the current HTTP response.

User

Gets or sets security information for the current HTTP request.

public override System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal User { get; set; }
Value
IPrincipal

An object that contains security information for the current HTTP request.

AddError(Exception)

Adds an exception to the exception collection for the current HTTP request.

public override void AddError (Exception errorInfo);
errorInfo
Exception

The exception to add to the exception collection.

ClearError()

Clears all errors for the current HTTP request.

public override void ClearError ();

String

Gets a page-level resource object based on the specified stem.Web.Compilation.ExpressionBuilderContext.VirtualPath* and stem.Web.Compilation.ResourceExpressionFields.ResourceKey* properties, and on the CultureInfo object.

GetSection(String)

Gets the specified configuration section of the current application's default configuration.

public override object GetSection (string sectionName);
sectionName
String

The configuration section path (in XPath format) and the configuration element name.

Returns
Object

The specified section, or null if the section does not exist.

GetService(Type)

Returns an object for the current service type.

public override object GetService (Type serviceType);

Type

The type of service to get.

Returns
Object

The current service type, or null if no service is found.

RewritePath(String)

Rewrites the URL by using the specified path.

public override void RewritePath (string path);
path
String

The replacement path.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

path is null.

HttpException

path is not in the current application's root directory.

RewritePath(String,Boolean)

Rewrites the URL by using the specified path and a value that specifies whether the virtual path for server resources is modified.

public override void RewritePath (string path, bool rebaseClientPath);
path
String

The path to rewrite to.

rebaseClientPath
Boolean

true to reset the virtual path; false to keep the virtual path unchanged.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

path is null.

HttpException

path is not in the current application's root directory.

RewritePath(String,String,String)

Rewrites the URL by using the specified path, path information, and query string information.

public override void RewritePath (string filePath, string pathInfo, string queryString);
filePath
String

The replacement path.

pathInfo
String

Additional path information for a resource.

queryString
String

The request query string.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

The filePath parameter is null.

HttpException

The filePath parameter is not in the current application's root directory.

RewritePath(String,String,String,Boolean)

Rewrites the URL by using the specified path, path information, query string information, and a value that specifies whether the client file path is set to the rewrite path.

public override void RewritePath (string filePath, string pathInfo, string queryString, bool setClientFilePath);
filePath
String

The replacement path.

pathInfo
String

Additional path information for a resource.

queryString
String

The request query string.

setClientFilePath
Boolean

true to set the file path used for client resources to the value of the filePath parameter; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

filePath is null.

HttpException

filePath is not in the current application's root directory.
